reviews.title: GONE TO THE DOGS...AND RIGHTLY SO
text: Just west of the Gooderham Building is this haven for dog lovers. Have never seen a fountain topped by a dog bone! It's a whimsical water source. Lots of benches to chill, whether a canine lover or not.

reviews.title: Dog Fountain
text: This is a great little park. The fountain is adorable. There's lots of seating available. You could easily pick up lunch at St. Lawrence market and picnic here.

reviews.title: Quirky
text: This is a quirky fountain just behind the flat iron building in a pleasant small park. The statues of different dog breeds are both inside and out of the fountain. Hub for dog walkers

reviews.title: The Quirkiest Fountain EVER!
text: Berczy Park is a short walk from Union Station and St Lawrence Market. It's a place you can take your dog for a walk quite easily and they may enjoy the fountain too.
The fountain is lots of dogs spitting water from their mouths into the water in different locations and there is a bone at the top of the fountain. Perhaps this is what they are all aiming for?
Don't forget to look out for the cats!

reviews.title: Unusual Dog Park
text: We just happened to come across Berczy Park and it was lovely. The main feature is an interesting, unusual fountain full of dog sculptures all over it, with the large sculpture of a bone at the very top. This is a dog park! There are also several other works of art in the park which make it even more welcoming.

reviews.title: My favorite place in Toronto
text: Believe it or not, Berczy Park is my favorite place in Toronto. Ever since the "dog fountain" was built at this place, I never miss a single opportunity to go and spend at least a half of hour here and it doesn't matter if it's summer or winter. I have been here every day during my current visit to Toronto. It's relaxing to sit here and watch people taking pictures by the fountain, walking their dogs, sitting and talking... Berczy Park is literally an oasis of calm in the middle of the big city.
In winter, the "fountain dogs" have scarves tied around their necks and the park is decorated with Christmas lights. In the summer, the water gushes from the dogs' mouths.

When I wrote my first review of this place a few years ago, I mentioned that the fountain is made up of statues of dogs looking at a golden bone placed at the top of the fountain. And that there is one cat that doesn't care about the bone and just looks somewhere else. The author of the fountain himself replied to this review and pointed out to me that the cat was looking at a specific place. And yes, he looks at... No no, I won't tell. When you're in Berczy Park, try to find what the cat is looking at. :-)

reviews.title: Cute Downtown Fountain
text: What an adorable little park in the middle of downtown. The theme is whimsical and fun. The only downside to our visit was a man bathing (washing himself) in the lower bowl of the fountain.  We simply walked around to the other side and enjoyed the the sculptures and even spotted the one cat.

reviews.title: Must-See Dog Fountain
text: It's a must-see, day and night.  It's just a cute dog fountain, but I loved it.  (Find the cat and what it's looking at.) It is right next to the Gooderham building aka the Flatiron and near the St. Lawrence Market, where you can get picnic supplies or a pea meal (Canadian bacon) sandwich that is delightful.  Also near C'est What, a beer bar that was highly recommended by our tour guide (didn't make it there yet.). Note:  better in spring/summer, as the water will be turned off in cold weather.

reviews.title: Interesting fountain
text: A small park. There is a interesting fountain with dog sculptures, other than that, nothing much. St Lawrence market is nearby so you may want to have a short visit on the way to the market.

reviews.title: Great little park
text: This park has improved since our last visit in 2016. It is a few minutes walk from the Hockey Hall of Fame along Front Street. The great Gooderham Building is at one end and a couple of nice pieces of public art there are interesting along with the fountain featuring dogs having a drink. A fine place for a short relax.

reviews.title: Take A Break Here!
text: We were at a nearby hotel, and wound up stopping here each evening of our vacation. There are lots of people living in condos nearby who walk their dogs here, so it feels more like a neighborhood spot than a tourist place, which we like. The fountain is fun during the day and even more fun at night, when it is lit. Please note that while dogs cover this fountain, there's a cat clearly ruling the fountain, and another on a gate ruling the park!

Warning: Toronto seems to have more panhandlers/homeless than I see in my native NYC, and some may be sleeping in this park. They are not hurting anyone, but if such things bother you, be aware that they are present.

reviews.title: Lovely place to chill and people watch
text: Yes it’s about dog lovers (although the discerning eye will find the two cat statues) but this is a gorgeous summer park for everyone to enjoy.
Steps from St.Lawrence Market (a MUST visit if you’re visiting), theatre district, shopping and many restaurants - it’s a wonder place to visit in the summer!

reviews.title: Mesmerizing Absurd Fountain
text: I work down town, and a few years back when the park was shut down this was irritating as it's a nice location to eat your lunch and didn't seem broken. The renovations for it took for. ev. er. But it's a delight, truly. I thought the fountain was the stupidest looking thing I'd ever seen as it was being constructed, but fully functional and filled with water it's just so much more than that - imagine a dog loving childs drawing of a fountain in dog heaven. It's here, on Wellington. Just bloody bananas. It's still a nice place to sit and eat lunch, still alright for a kind of green space. When troupes do Shakespeare in this park, it's usually a 'follow the actors' experience and well worth it. Kudos to the artist for adding the odd disinterested cat sculpture.

reviews.title: Love the dog fountain
text: Went to the park to start a walking tour round old town Toronto and glad we arrived early . The dog fountain had only just been switched back on ( turned off for obvious reasons during the winter ) and was looking fresh and clean . You have to find ‘your’ dog breed and also look for the odd cat too . On the lamppost next to the fountain there are two little birds sat on an arm of the lamp ‘looking’ at the cat on the fountain. There are also other statues within the park and benches to sit on and chill . Lovely spot in a busy city .

reviews.title: The Canine Scene
text: We stopped by after breakfast at Fran's (right across the street). Such a cool fountain of various statue dogs w/mouth-water spouts shooting to the main fountain. It's a nice scenic photo area.

reviews.title: Charming Park in the City
text: I've taken the habit to detour on my way to wherever in Toronto just to stop for a break in Berczy Park. It is absolutely cute with its central fountain - which might be a bit kitschy, yes - but which also goes so well with the real dogs having fun and meeting each other all around

reviews.title: A rest stop from our walk before breakfast!
text: We walked to the Front Street area before breakfast from our hotel on Dundas Square. The fountain is well done and different from anything I've seen elsewhere. It's a comfortable spot to sit on a bench and look at the wonderful buildings in the area.

reviews.title: Love it
text: Must take the time to sit and watch the real dogs sniff the fountain dogs. Always amusing to witness.

reviews.title: Cute place
text: It is so original the fountain of dogs. Also the building that is like a gift opening is cute.
To sit there and just admire how people walk with its dogs and have a book and coffee with you is so calming and enjoyable

reviews.title: Amazing and cute
text: What a unique design and stunning fountain.
We went out of our way to find this on way to distillery district and so glad we did.
Just lovely even though a biased dog lover.

reviews.title: Cheery sight, cute dog fountain
text: We stopped by Berczy Park last month on our way to Union Station for the commute home. This is our second time at Berczy Park, the first was back in June. We only had time then to take a quick photo of the cute dog fountain as we were heading to Gooderham Building and somewhere else but I told myself we will come back another time.

Since it was already Nov, the dog fountain was drained and turned off for the coming winter. It was still fun to look at but an incomplete scene without the water coming out from all the dogs’ mouths. That was a more cheery sight and definitely dog-approved as dog owners do stop by with their pets here. The good thing about visiting Berczy Park on a cold afternoon was that people were not lingering around and we got a good look at the statues. We made sure to find the one cat staring at the two birds perched on a lamp post. Aside from the decorative fountain, there is a green space, a couple of art installation, a few round tables and chairs and lots of park benches. As we were leaving, we found one other cat on top of the reflective cabinet at the corner of Front St E and Scott St.

reviews.title: "Dog" Fountain
text: Berczy Park is a little green oasis in the midst of a concrete city area. The fountain is embellished with figures of dogs, and it is surrounded by seating areas and green grass.

reviews.title: PHOTO OPPORTUNITY
text: Quirky but entertaining fixture in a great location. My wife and I popped to the fountain when in Toronto whilst touring East Canada and enjoyed the sights. It's a real photo opportunity when in the marvellous city of Toronto. While there we had the opportunity to see several of the competitors in the marathon that was happening that particular Sunday.

reviews.title: Great little park by the St. Lawrence Market and Gooderham Building.
text: Just to the west of the St. Lawrence Market and butted up against the Gooderham Flatiron Building this park has a lot of character. The dog fountain is a real treat.

reviews.title: Iconic dog fountain
text: Visited here with my wife and we were amazed at the fountain where there were different types of dog statues each spouting water from their mouths into the fountain. Amazing

reviews.title: Loved the dog fountain
text: Not much of a park but I loved the dog fountain.  Very cute dogs of various breeds lining the fountain on all sides on all levels, with one crazy cat thrown in for good measure.  Of course the rotten cat is not spraying water like the dogs are, but that seems about right.  Very fun.

reviews.title: Fun find
text: We spent the day walking downtown and stumbled on Berczy Park and it’s fun fountain of dogs.  It is a nice place to stop for a bit and just enjoy the area, it also gives you a good view of the mural artwork on the back of the Flatiron building.  There is a large cat statue on the way out of the park sitting on a service box keeping an eye over everything.

reviews.title: Quirky little park
text: We passed through Berczy Park on a Tuesday, there was some filming going on for TV show called Titans. Although small it is a nice walk through with the very quirky Dog Fountain.

reviews.title: Unique and beautiful
text: We saw this as we were on a driven guided tour and purposely came back on foot to see this fountain. We arrived on a Saturday at about 1.30pm and it was switched off but signs were up to say it would be back on an hour later. We assume this was because an outdoor theatre group were evacuated performing a Shakespearean play and needed to cut out the noise. When it was switched on it was wonderful. Children sat on the dogs on the outside of the fountain, squirting the water everywhere. It was a lovely hot, sunny day so no one minded getting splashed. Whilst it was switched off a lady with a guide dog in training jumped in to get cool and was fascinated with all the dogs, going up to give them a sniff. Very amusing. Lots of seats and grassy areas to sit down and just watch and chill. Also handy if going to St Lawrence market a few minutes away.

reviews.title: Neat Little Park, Great Fountain
text: Berczy Park is a fun little park we stumbled upon one day and it is even a little magical at night. It is a new park opened in 2017, that has a 3 tier fountain with 27 cast iron dogs spouting water to all levels of the fountain. There are also 2 cats on the fountain looking confused as well as a bone on top of the fountain. The lighting is great and would recommend an evening visit if in the area. The historic Gooderham Flatiron building borders one side of the park and it is close to the St. Lawrence Market.

reviews.title: A higgen gem in the middle of downtown Toronto, the dog fountain!
text: I needed a new suitcase so we walked from the Fairmont Royal York down to Winners, about 10 minutes away from hotel ! And, what to our  wondering eyes did we find, but this amazing dog fountain.........Loved it, sat and enjoyed it for a bit, and took pix of all breeds, and the one kitty , what fun! A hidden gem in the city.......... And yes, I did get a new Roots suitcase at Walmart, a wonderful trip to Toronto and this was definitely a highlight!

reviews.title: The best fountain I’ve ever seen!
text: This fountain is incredible!!! We stumbled across it whilst walking back from St Lawrence Market and we loved it. We are both dog lovers, so this was the definitely the place for us. There is a cute bone at the top, with a range of different dogs dotted all around.
If you go, find the only cat on the edge of the fountain and see what they are looking at - super cute.
Definitely go, this park is fabulous!

reviews.title: Dog Fountain
text: Really nice park with a great dog fountain.  This is right next to the Gooderham building and close to St. Lawrence so a nice stop.

reviews.title: The Dog Fountain
text: I passed by Berczy Park on the way to visit the St. Lawrence food market.  There is a fantastic dog fountain with statues of every kind of dog.  It is a great photo opportunity and a great think to look at.

reviews.title: Give a dog a bone!
text: We came across this wonderful fountain quite by accident . We have never seen anything like this before ! Well worth a visit ! Enjoy!

reviews.title: Nice relaxing place to be
text: A lovely park, the fountain was very cute with all the dogs, but unfortunately it wasn’t going when we got there, so imagine it would look wonderful.

reviews.title: Small cosy park
text: Located behind the iconic Gooderham building, Berczy park is a small park to chill on downtown Toronto. There is a very interesting dog fountain as well as a number of other artistic installations. It is a hood place to spend sometime in.

reviews.title: Tiny Green Oasis in a Dense Concrete Jungle
text: Terrific and quirky park with plenty of seating, some fun and cool people watching and one of the most enjoyable fountains in the city. The doggy fount is a blast....fun, silly, pretty, and well loved. I really like this park and always make a point to stroll through when I go to nearby St Lawrence mkt. Enjoy....it's great!

reviews.title: Downtown Oasis
text: Lovely little park on Front St. near Victoria. Awesome fountain, honouring dogs, as well as other interesting sculptures. Lots of park benches.

reviews.title: Doggy Dog World
text: This is a small little park that my girlfriend and I happened to stumble upon when we were exploring Toronto. It's got a few cool things to see and take pictures with / of. The primary one being of course, the large fountain covered in dog statues (and one cat).
Very quiet, peaceful place and the fountain makes you laugh, or at least smile. It's a bit silly, and very creative.
I'm glad we stumbled across this small park.
